<h2 id="Overview">Overview<a class="anchor-link" href="#Overview">¶</a></h2><p>This blog presents my attempt to discover topics and categorize the sections in the SEC XBRL filings using topic modeling technique. The discovered topics can help to facilitate querying filing sections by meaningful topics, for example searching all income tax related sections, or analyze filing sections based on their categories.</p>
<h2 id="Table-of-Contents">Table of Contents<a class="anchor-link" href="#Table-of-Contents">¶</a></h2><ol>
<li><a href="#section_1">Collectiong Data</a></li>
<li><a href="#section_2">Cleaning and Preprocessing Text</a></li>
<li><a href="#section_3">Creating LDA Topic Model</a></li>
<li><a href="#section_4">Assigning Topics to Sections</a></li>
<li><a href="#section_5">Connecting LDA Topics to Accounting Standard Codification Topics</a></li>
<li><a href="#section_6">Case Study: Analyzing Usages of Customized Tag By Topics</a> </li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Collecting-Data"><a id="section_1"></a>Collecting Data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Collecting-Data">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The filings are collected from the SEC <strong><a href="https://www.sec.gov/edgar/searchedgar/accessing-edgar-data.htm">Edgar</a></strong> website. I have selected 10-K filings with period end date between 2016-04-01 and 2017-04-01. There are total of 5602 filings in the data set. Each filing is parsed with the python package <strong><a href="https://github.com/Arelle/Arelle">Arelle</a></strong> to retrieve the title, and concepts from each section in the filing. A filing section, in XBRL terms, is a presentation group identified by an extended link role(ELR) URI. In this article, the word "ELR" is used interchangeably with the "section".</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Cleaning-and-Preprocessing-Text"><a id="section_2"></a>Cleaning and Preprocessing Text<a class="anchor-link" href="#Cleaning-and-Preprocessing-Text">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Each section(ELR) in a filing has a title and a list of concepts. Each concept has a short text description called a label describling the meaning of the concept. We treat each section as a document composed of the text of the title and the concatenation of all concept labels. The title and concept labels are preprocessed with the following steps,</p>
<ol>
<li><p>Remove stop words. 
The stop words are common words that frequently appear in any document, and so serve no purpose of distinghishing documents. The common English stop words includs "the", "are", "about" etc. We have extended the English stop word set with the domain specific words such as "statement", "disclosure", "line", "item", "table", "axis" etc. These words appear in many section titles or concept labels and they bear insignificant meanings on the document.</p>
</li>
<li><p>Remove non-word characters and parenthese/bracket enclosed content.
 The parenthese enclosed content, such as "(detail)", "(table)" etc, in section titles normally indicate the level of filing. The bracket enclosed content in concept labels indicate the type of concepts. They hold no semantic meanings on the section or concepts.</p>
</li>
<li><p>Lemmatize words.
 Lemmatization normalizes the word representation. It turns a word to the base form of the word. For example, the plural word "revenues" is changed to the singular form "revenue". The lemmatization process reduces the word form variations and relates various word forms to the same base form.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Below is the preprocessing function,</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># this pattern is used in processing elr description and concept labels to remove the brackets/parentheses enclosed content and # digits</span>
<span class="n">remove_character_pattern</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">compile</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'\[.*\]|\(.*\)|\d'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># NLTK WordNetLemmatizer</span>
<span class="n">lemma</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">WordNetLemmatizer</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">preprocess_text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="c1"># remove any content enclosed with brackets/parentheses such as [Table]|[Abstract], number, and parentheses</span>
    <span class="n">text</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">remove_character_pattern</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">text</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># replace any non word character with space</span>
    <span class="n">text</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'\W'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">text</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># tokenization and lemmatization</span>
    <span class="n">words</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">lemma</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lemmatize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">word</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">text</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lower</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">split</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">word</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">stop_word_set</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">words</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<h2 id="Create-Topic-Model"><a id="section_3"></a>Create Topic Model<a class="anchor-link" href="#Create-Topic-Model">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="What-is-topic-modeling">What is topic modeling<a class="anchor-link" href="#What-is-topic-modeling">¶</a></h3><p><strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Topic_model">Topic modeling</a></strong> is an unsupervised document clustering method. It is often used to discover topics in a document collection, and catagorize documents based on the discoved topics. The most polpular technique used for fitting a topic model is called <strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latent_Dirichlet_allocation">LDA(Latent Dirichlet Allocation)</a></strong>.</p>
<p>LDA assumes each document is generated by a topic distribution, and each topic is generated by a word distribution. That is, for each word in a document, you select a topic from a distribution over topics, and then pick up a word from the word distribution for that topic. For example, suppose the document collections has 4 topics "cash flows", "comprehensive income", "leases" and "debt". When generating a document, you first select a topic from a topic distribution for the document, say 60% for "cash flows", 20% for "comprehensive income", 10% for "leases" and "debt" respectively, if the selected topic is "cash flows", next you draw a word from the word distribution for the topic "cash flows". The document is created by repeating the process of each word generation. For a given number of topics and a collection of documents, the process of LDA is to estimate the topic distribution for each document, and the word distribution for each topic.</p>
<h3 id="Creating-a-topic-model">Creating a topic model<a class="anchor-link" href="#Creating-a-topic-model">¶</a></h3><p>LDA is an unsupervised learning process, meaning that you don't need to provide a label for each document to train the model, but it requires users to provide the specific number of topics for the given collection of document. For this data collection, I have tried 30, 40, 50 and 60 topics, and choose 30 topics at last for the least topic overlaps and the highest level of interpretability.</p>
<p>The following code snippt creates the topic model using python <strong><a href="https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/">gensim</a></strong> package,</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">num_topics</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">30</span>
<span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">ELRCorpus</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">object</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="fm">__init__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">elr_cursor</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">elr_dictionary</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">elr_cursor</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elr_cursor</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">elr_dictionary</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elr_dictionary</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="fm">__iter__</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">elr_cursor</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">rewind</span><span class="p">()</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">elr</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">elr_cursor</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">yield</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">elr_dictionary</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">doc2bow</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ELRTitleWords'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">elr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ELRBaseLabelWords'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">elr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ELRExtLabelWords'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">build_dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr_cursor</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">dictionary</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">corpora</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Dictionary</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ELRTitleWords'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">elr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ELRBaseLabelWords'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">elr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ELRExtLabelWords'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">elr</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">elr_cursor</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="n">dictionary</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">filter_extremes</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">keep_n</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10000</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">no_below</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># filter_extremes(no_below=5, no_above=0.5, keep_n=100000)</span>
    <span class="n">dictionary</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">compactify</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">dictionary</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">create_model</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr_collection</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num_topics</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dictionary_path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">corpus_path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tfidf_corpus_path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lda_model_path</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">elr_cursor</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elr_collection</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">find</span><span class="p">()</span>

    <span class="c1"># build the dictionary for the words in ELR title and concept labels</span>
    <span class="n">elr_dictionary</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">build_dict</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr_cursor</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">corpora</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Dictionary</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">save</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr_dictionary</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">dictionary_path</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># create a corpus for the ELRs by converting ELR documents into document term matrix</span>
    <span class="n">elr_corpus</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ELRCorpus</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr_cursor</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">elr_dictionary</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1"># save the corpus in BleiCorpus format</span>
    <span class="n">BleiCorpus</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">serialize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">corpus_path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">elr_corpus</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">id2word</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">elr_dictionary</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># convert the document term frequency matrix into the inverse document term frequence matrix</span>
    <span class="n">tfidf</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gensim</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">models</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tfidfmodel</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">TfidfModel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">elr_corpus</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">tfidf_corpus</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tfidf</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">elr_corpus</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">BleiCorpus</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">serialize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tfidf_corpus_path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">tfidf_corpus</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">id2word</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">elr_dictionary</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># Train LDA model from the inverse document term frequency matrix                                                  </span>
    <span class="n">lda_model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gensim</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">models</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LdaModel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tfidf_corpus</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num_topics</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">id2word</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elr_dictionary</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">lda_model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">save</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lda_model_path</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">lda_model</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note: I have initially stored the data set in MongoDB. This code snippet reads data from MongoDB. It can be easily adapted to read from a CSV file. I have also saved the resulting dictionary, corpus, and LDA model to files for later use.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Assign-topics-to-ELRs"><a id="section_4"></a>Assign topics to ELRs<a class="anchor-link" href="#Assign-topics-to-ELRs">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Once we have the topic model, we can infer the topics for each filing section.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="load-dictionary,-coprpus-and-LDA-model">load dictionary, coprpus and LDA model<a class="anchor-link" href="#load-dictionary,-coprpus-and-LDA-model">¶</a></h3><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">dictionary_path</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'../models/elr_dictionary.dict'</span>
<span class="n">tfidf_corpus_path</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'../models/tfidf_corpus.lda-c'</span>
<span class="n">lda_path</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'../models/elr_lda_tfidf_'</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num_topics</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s1">'_topics.lda'</span>

<span class="n">dictionary</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gensim</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corpora</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Dictionary</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">load</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dictionary_path</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">tfidf_corpus</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gensim</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">corpora</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">BleiCorpus</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tfidf_corpus_path</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">lda_model</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gensim</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">models</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ldamodel</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LdaModel</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">load</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">lda_path</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Create-document-topic-distribution-dataframe-from-the-LDA-Model">Create document topic distribution dataframe from the LDA Model<a class="anchor-link" href="#Create-document-topic-distribution-dataframe-from-the-LDA-Model">¶</a></h3><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">gamma</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">_</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">lda_model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">inference</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tfidf_corpus</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">doc_topic_dists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">gamma</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">gamma</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)[:,</span> <span class="bp">None</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Assign-the-most-probable-topic-to-each-ELR">Assign the most probable topic to each ELR<a class="anchor-link" href="#Assign-the-most-probable-topic-to-each-ELR">¶</a></h3><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># elr_df is the pandas dataframe for the resulting dataset, for each section,we choose the topic with the highest probablity.</span>
<span class="n">elr_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'TopicId'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">argmax</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">doc_topic_dists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Connecting-LDA-Topics-with-Accounting-Standard-Codification-Topics"><a id="section_5"></a>Connecting LDA Topics with Accounting Standard Codification Topics<a class="anchor-link" href="#Connecting-LDA-Topics-with-Accounting-Standard-Codification-Topics">¶</a></h2><p>LDA model provides topic distributions for each document, but it does not provide labels for the topics. We can make some sense of these topics by the word distributions for topics.<br />
Gets the top 10 words for each topic from the topic model topid word distributions</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">topic_word_dist</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'topic_id'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'word'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'prob'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">topic_id</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">num_topics</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">word</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">prob</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">lda_model</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show_topic</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">topic_id</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">topn</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">topic_word_dist</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">topic_word_dist</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'topic_id'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">topic_id</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'word'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">word</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'prob'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">prob</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="bp">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Based on the word distributions, and also the most common tags in each topic, I have attempted an interpretation by connecting these 30 LDA topics to the topics defined in the <strong><a href="https://asc.fasb.org/">Accounting Standard Codification</a></strong>, and the sections defined in the <strong><a href="http://xbrl.fasb.org/us-gaap/2016/">US-GAAP taxonomy</a></strong>. The table below shows some of the topic interpretation. Note that I have very limited accounting knowledge. The interpretation may not be accurate, or even incorrect.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Topical-Analysis-on-Usages-of-Customized-Tags"><a id="section_6"></a>Topical Analysis on Usages of Customized Tags<a class="anchor-link" href="#Topical-Analysis-on-Usages-of-Customized-Tags">¶</a></h2>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Once we have assigned a topic for each section, we can analyze the dataset based on the topics. One use case is to analyze the customized tags usage in terms of topics. The US filers are allowed to use company specific tags in their XBRL filings besides the standard tags defined in the <strong><a href="http://xbrl.fasb.org/us-gaap/2016/">US-GAAP</a></strong>. While these customized tags might be valuable for finding company specifics, they certainly increase difficulties for comparative analysis across company filings, and to some extent, defeat the very purpose of using standard vacabulary to enhance interprebablity. Therefore, it is helpful for standard setters and regularlators to estimate and understand the usages of these customized tags in the filings.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This code snippet calculates the number of sections(ELRs) that only use the standard tags for each topic.</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">topic_summary</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'topic_id'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'base_elrs'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'ext_elrs'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'total_elrs'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">topic_summary</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'topic_id'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">30</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">topic_summary</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'total_elrs'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elr_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'TopicId'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">size</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span>
<span class="n">topic_summary</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'base_elrs'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">elr_df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">elr_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ELRExtConcepts'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">isnull</span><span class="p">()]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'TopicId'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">size</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">values</span>
<span class="n">topic_summary</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'ext_elrs'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">topic_summary</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'total_elrs'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">topic_summary</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'base_elrs'</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The visualization of the percentage of sections with only standard tags versus the sections with mixed standard and customized tags for each topic. hover over the circles and see the topics and percentage of sections that contain only standard tags. As can be seen from the visualization, most of topics are consisted of around 50% sections with only standard tags and 50% sections with mixed tags. But there are couple of topics with extreme cases.</p>
</div>
</div>
